etymologies: late Middle English. From enthronize + -ation, probably after Middle French, French intronisation act of enthroning a bishop, act of enthroning a ruler and its etymon post-classical Latin inthronizatio, intronizatio act of enthroning a bishop, act of enthroning a ruler

definitions: The action or an act of enthroning someone; especially the formal or ceremonial induction to office of a monarch, bishop, etc.; = "enthronement".
